serviceDescription: Default SSL Web port.
Customer Experience Improvement Program (CEIP) for Site Recovery Manager
purpose: Customer Experience Improvement Program (CEIP) for Site Recovery Manager

serviceDescription:
All management traffic to Site Recovery Manager Server Appliance goes to this port. This includes traffic by external API clients for task automation and HTTPS interface for downloading the UI plug-in and icons. This port must be accessible from the vCenter Server proxy system. Used by vSphere Web Client to download the Site Recovery Manager client plug-in. Note:
If the Platform Services Controller is installed on the same machine, you must change this port.

source: Site Recovery Manager on the recovery site
serviceDescription: Traffic from the Site Recovery Manager Server on the recovery site to ESXi hosts when recovering or testing virtual machines with configured IP customization, or callout commands on recovered virtual machines.

destination: Platform Services Controller and vCenter Server
serviceDescription: Site Recovery Manager to vCenter Server communication - local and remote.
Traffic from Site Recovery Manager Server to local and remote Platform Services Controller.
Default SSL Web Port for incoming TCP traffic.
Site Recovery Manager Appliance Management Interface

destination: Site Recovery Manager Server Appliance on target site
serviceDescription: Bidirectional communication between Site Recovery Manager Appliance servers.
vCenter Server and target Site Recovery Manager Appliance communication.

source: Site Recovery Manager Server on the recovery site.
serviceDescription: Traffic from the Site Recovery Manager Server on the recovery site to ESXi hosts when recovering or testing virtual machines with IP customization, with configured callout commands on recovered virtual machines, or that use raw disk mapping (RDM). All NFC traffic for updating or patching the VMX files of virtual machines that are replicated using vSphere Replication use this port.
Site Recovery Manager database connectivity to Oracle.
Site Recovery Manager database connectivity to Oracle.

destination: vSphere Replication appliance on the recovery and protected sites
serviceDescription: Management traffic between Site Recovery Manager instances and vSphere Replication appliances.

All management traffic to Site Recovery Manager Server goes to this port. This includes traffic by external API clients for task automation and HTTPS interface for downloading the UI plug-in and icons. This port must be accessible from the vCenter Server proxy system. Used by vSphere Web Client to download the Site Recovery Manager client plug-in.

destination: Site Recovery Manager Server on target site
serviceDescription: Bidirectional communication between Site Recovery Manager servers.

destination: vSphere Replication appliance on the recovery site
serviceDescription: Initial replication traffic. From the ESXi host at the protected site to the vSphere Replication appliance at the recovery site.

source: ESXi host on the source site
destination: vSphere Replication server at the target site
serviceDescription: Initial and outgoing replication traffic from the ESXi host at the source site to the vSphere Replication appliance or vSphere Replication server at the target site for replication traffic with network encryption.
Default port for the Site Recovery UI client. Note:If the Platform Services Controller is installed on the same machine, you must change this port.

destination: Local and remote vCenter Server or all vCenter Server instances in Enhanced Linked Mode on which there is a registered Site Recovery Manager. For more information about Enhanced Linked Mode, see vCenter Enhanced Linked Mode for vCenter Server Appliance in the vCenter Server Installation and Setup documentation.
